definition: can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy

sentences.english: Patients did not always get the correct medication.
sentences.chinese: 病人并非总能拿到正确的药物。

sentences.english: I was always able to figure out more or less where he was.
sentences.chinese: 我总能多多少少地找到他在哪里。

sentences.english: But high taxes do not always mean expensive cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 高额烟草税不总能让烟价高不可攀。

sentences.english: One can no longer walk the streets without seeing beggars importuning passers by.
sentences.chinese: 走在街上总能看到乞丐纠缠行人乞讨。

sentences.english: Ice cream always makes his mouth  water.
sentences.chinese: 冰淇淋总能让他馋得淌口水。

sentences.english: Those activities always attract kids to use the Internet for a while or all night long.
sentences.chinese: 这些活动总能吸引孩子们使用互联网的同时，或通夜。

sentences.english: Because you get to hear which side will win.
sentences.chinese: 你总能听到哪一方将会获胜的消息。

sentences.english: People always believe that self-criticism, self-recognition is not.
sentences.chinese: 自我批评总能让人相信，自我表扬则不然。

sentences.english: NIKOLAY DAVYDENKO: Shock, maybe just for press shocked, because Nadal always winning here.
sentences.chinese: 很雷，但是是压迫的雷，因为纳达尔在这儿总能赢。

sentences.english: What we love to do we find time to do.
sentences.chinese: 我们喜欢做的事，总能找到时间去做。

sentences.english: Clara has always been very perceptive about whether her employees are being honest.
sentences.chinese: 克拉罗总能看透他的员工是否诚实。

sentences.english: Children are in some way cunning , they always know how to get what they want.
sentences.chinese: 孩子有时很狡猾，他们总能得到他们想要的。

sentences.english: "Tracy, he will find people, " Adelman said.
Due to his reputation, he is able to acquire the most interesting cases.
sentences.chinese: 他名声大噪，因此总能获得最有意思的案子。

sentences.english: It takes a long time, and I don't always get them all.
sentences.chinese: 耙叶子要花很时间，我还并不总能把落叶都耙好。

sentences.english: because, in return, I always got the healthiest one.
sentences.chinese: 因为作为回报，我总能获得最健康的东西。

definition: to be definitely able (to do sth)
inspiration/insight/a burst of creativity in scientific or artistic endeavor
all/both/entirely/(used for emphasis) even/already/(not) at all
